captions.text:
Based on the terrible books from one of the
sh*ttiest authors of all time,

comes a movie adaptation for teenage girls
who aren't smart enough for The Hunger

You'll be on the edge of your seat as voice-over
describes everything.

"I used to spend two weeks there almost every
summer."
"My first day at a new school."
Kind of like a book, actually.

This catatonic teenager will fall for the
world's gayest vampire.

A film that teaches young girls that the only
thing that matters is finding a man...
"So, how long have you been like this?"

But don't worry, it's not pedophilia because
he looks 17.

Together, they will have the romance of a
lifetime

A love challenged by the fact that he might
accidentally f*ck her to death,
and her inability to pour ketchup.

A film that conditioned a generation of girls
to think that love is keeping tabs on

I know this looks creepy, but it's really
romantic in the movie.
Twilight: it's just a metaphor for abstinence.

Get ready for an hour and a half of people
standing in semi-circles,
just to get to 5 minutes of cool stuff.

comments.text:
+AngelOfDarkness
I can assure you, the overwhelming majority of people don't have even the 
slightest intention of actually carrying out their threats. They're just 
venting their frustration, that's all.

Sorry about the crack I made earlier. You seem like a nice person. Just 
relax and try not to take things too seriously, especially the Internet. 
After all, life's too short to be miserable. :)
